Description: Lower body and conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black with reserved dot in centre; exterior: reserved on bowl and glazed streaky brown (fired reddish) on foot; underside reserved and probably originally slipped, now worn; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: The number 766 is written in pencil on the underside of the foot. For parallels regarding squat patterned chalices, see Lemos no. 1062 from Kamiros.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 55)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1055) (phase 2)
